alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Kennebec; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kennebec, eastern Oxford, north central Androscoggin and southeastern Franklin Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jay, or 12 miles southwest of Farmington, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Jay, Belgrade, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Canton, Wilton, Livermore, Chesterville, Hartford, Fayette, Carthage, Rome, Mount Vernon, New Sharon, Vienna, Readfield, and Mercer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western, south central, southwestern and west central Maine.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Kennebec; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford
